page.title: 22LEP
page.content:
The LEP stands for the Lancashire Evening Post. This paper has an issue every day which costs 50p. Sometimes in other papers for example the Daily Mail or the Daily Express they print out vouchers where if you cut them out you can get a discount. You can get the LEP from your local newsagents a stall in the town centre or delivered to your door. The LEP has a large website which you can go on to get past news or that days news. If you would like to get an advert in this paper it will cost you but if you want to print an article it wont.
Contribution by: Alex Clarkson
